intro: Anacampseros subrotunda, commonly known as the round-leafed stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are typically rounded or oval in shape. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Anacampseros subrotunda is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and drought tolerance.
